After the landing of bug 226890 clicking on a news link
example:
news://news.mozilla.org:119/lJGdnWgY2eWzCanQnZ2dnUVZ_tydnZ2d@mozilla.org
Results in a mail composition window with the contents of the target message as an .htm attachment.

My guess is that the links are being detected as mailto uri's

Expected result:
The newsgroup should just open, with the message displayed.

I have seen this in Thunderbird 8, selecting a news: URI contained in the body of a newsgroup message.  Actually, I found this bug report when preparing to submit a new bug report on the same problem.  

On the other hand, selecting a news: URI on a Web page in SeaMonkey displays the message in SeaMonkey and not in Thunderbird.  (I don't use SeaMonkey as a newsreader; I use it only as a browser.)  That would be a different (new?) bug report.  Is comment #2 the result of selecting a news: URI via a browser and not via Thunderbird?

comments.raw_text:
Thunderbird 8 does not contain the enhancements in bug 226890
That bugs should allow newsgroup links to work (in TB11)

What I have just now discovered that, in fact some links work after I manually set TB as my default newsreader via Control Panel>>Internet options.(Winxp)

Some (probably malformed) news url's still open in a composition window, and I have yet to get a news link in the browser (Firefox) to open the message in a running Thunderbird.

David , you might be interested in reading through bug 226890
specifically https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=226890#c78

I'll test further as time allows.
